notes: Final generation sports car discontinued after 2024 model year. Aluminum-intensive construction requires specialized repair techniques. Supercharged engines require premium fuel and precise timing. Data sourced from Wikipedia Jaguar F-Type article, January 2025 revision.

Second generation midsize luxury sedan X260 (2015-2024). Aluminum-intensive architecture. Discontinued in North America after 2024 model year. Data sourced from Wikipedia Jaguar XF article, January 2025 revision.
Compact luxury sedan on aluminum-intensive architecture. Discontinued in North America after 2024 model year. Data sourced from Wikipedia Jaguar XE article, January 2025 revision.

First generation F-Pace X761 (2016-present). Available with mild hybrid 3.0L I6 starting 2021. Aluminum-intensive construction. SVR performance variant features supercharged V8. Data sourced from Wikipedia Jaguar F-Pace article, January 2025 revision.
Compact luxury crossover X540 (2017-present). Built on transverse-engine platform. Standard 9-speed automatic transmission. Data sourced from Wikipedia Jaguar E-Pace article, January 2025 revision.

engines: Dual electric motors (394 hp combined, 512 lb-ft)
notes: All-electric crossover with 90 kWh lithium-ion battery pack. 400V high-voltage system requires EV-certified technicians. Aluminum-intensive construction. Estimated 234-256 miles EPA range. Data sourced from Wikipedia Jaguar I-Pace article, January 2025 revision.
